section.title: Future clauses with if, when, etc.
section.sectiontitle: We use a present verb after if, when, as soon as, before, after, unless, until to talk about the future.
section.text1a: If she fails her exam again, she'll be really upset.
section.text2a: Remember to turn off the lights before you leave.
section.sectiontitle2: In the other part of the sentence, we use a future form (going to, Present continuous, will etc.) or the imperative.
section.text3a: I won't do anything unless you phone.
section.text4a: Phone me as soon as you arrive.
